campaign.story:
Website Twitter YouTube
We love adventure games! And for the past six months, we have been working nights and weekends, to create an adventure of our own. You can see some of the results in the trailer above, or in the extended version down below. This has been an exiting journey so far, but we have realised that the amount of work that goes into making a game is unmanageable with our current work schedules. So… We turn to kickstarter for help! 
We would love to deliver this game, and think that there might be enough people out there who would like to see this game finished. We want to create an old-school feeling, 2d point and click adventure to all fans of the genre. We draw most of our inspiration from classic noir and cyberpunk movies as well as from the point and click adventure games of the 80/90s. With this game, we aim to create a tense, funny and atmospheric adventure, with a lot of twists and turns, vast character cabinet and a focus on telling an engaging story whilst letting the player solve intricate puzzles.
Pictures speak more than a thousand words, if you want to get an even better feel for the game, scroll down to the extended trailer!
We are hoping to release the game in the second half of 2022. Help us bring Invasive Recall to life!

In a not-so-distant future, advances in neurological science and artificial intelligence gives birth to a new technology by which it is possible to scan and interpret thoughts of the human mind. The procedure is soon discovered to wreak havoc on the minds of test subjects, rendering them severely demented or insane. Clinical trials are quickly ended, and the technology is put on hold until legislators permit law enforcement to use it on recently deceased victims of crime. By retrieving their last fading memories, detectives can find details vital to a case, often realising the identity of the perpetrator right at the crime scene. The process, dubbed “Invasive Recall”, is adopted by specially trained units who’s detectives go by the nickname “Mind Readers”.

Recall detectives John Landon and Rachel Hapley only know each other by reputation. Landon is a rookie detective for the city police; Rachel is working for a tech savvy, well funded privatized organization. Landon is investigating the murder of a prominent scientists while Rachel is working on a set of mysterious disappearances. Little do they know that their paths are about to cross, and that they soon will face a vastly more sinister truth than the everyday crime and corruption of the city.
 Classic 2d point and click adventure: We grew up with the point and click genre, and we think that it has time and again proven itself as a great vehicle for telling intriguing stories. We are not aiming to reinvent the wheel, we just want to take what was good of the classic games like maniac mansion, monkey island, fullthrottle and broken sword and make a traditional and well crafted game. 
Landon and his mentor Grimes entering a crime scene.
 Character switching: Switch between Rachel and Landon at will. Character switching is great for adding variety to both story and puzzles. It gives an alternative approach for the player if stuck and also opens up to interesting puzzles where character collaboration is the only solution.
Rachel and Landon reluctantly team up.
 Invasive Recall Mechanic: Utilize your Recall instrument to transfer memories of the recently deceased and play through their last moments alive. Uncover clues in the past that help you solve puzzles in the present.
The recall procedure is invaluable when it comes to gathering clues and moving the investigation forward.
 Vast city to explore: As you discover new places to explore you can move freely between the scenes of the city thanks to police responders used by both Landon and Rachel. 
Travel the city by selecting your destination on your responders on-board computer.
 Puzzles that enhance and move the story forward, without obstructing it: Our goal is to make the puzzles feel like a natural part of the world of the game, and never feel like something shoehorned in for the sake of adding friction. having said that, we do love puzzles and the game will have lots of them!
The coroner and the morgue is important assets when it comes to gathering information regarding the more morbid sides of the investigations.
 9 verb interface: Using the classic nine verb interface is in line with our approach to puzzle design. We want the player to think their way through our game, and we find this type of interface really engages the player and allows for more creative puzzles.
Landon is investigating someones bathroom.
 A dark and rainy mystery of epic proportions: Find out what is stirring beneath the surface of the city. Why are a handful of prominent scientist turning up dead? Why are ordinary people vanishing into thin air, never to be seen again?
The city holds many secrets.
 Lots of locations: We don't want to give to much away, but here are a few of the locations we have been working on...
The police station is a big part of the game. It houses the detective offices, interrogation rooms, a jail, and a morgue.
The path takes our detectives through the city's slums as well as some more high end establishments. Here they are at Kobayashi Tower.
Rachel is doing some investigating.
Not all events follow the main theme of the game. Here Landon has to find out what has driven his collegue Randy to escape into Virtual Reality. He's been using the office headset for days! Will Landon be able to get through to him before it's to late?

 Lots of animations: The game will have lots of animations, here is a sample from some of the animations for the main characters:
 The Game: Digital copy of the game on the platform of your choice: Pc, Mac, Linux, IOS, Android, Steam or GOG, DRM-Free.

 Digital Art Booklet: Includes promo art, background art, character art and "Making of" section with tutorials on character animation and backgrounds.

 Digital Soundtrack: Full digital soundtrack containing everything from smooth ballads to thrilling suspense music, all with an 80's electronic vibe.

 Criminal Record: Your own entry in the in-game searchable police database. Let players look you up, for a laugh or an interesting story. Provide a text and a picture (picture is optional and will be converted to pixel graphics) describing your escapades as a wanted criminal, or an innocent victim of circumstance, it's up to you. (text and picture is subject to our approval)

 Beta Tester: Get acces to demo builds. We believe that there is great value in getting feedback from the community. To make this an as polished experience as possible we will send out several demo builds of scenes being worked on and provide ways for you to give direct feedback to us. Help us make Invasive Recall an even greater experience!

 Producer: Get credited as producer. You will recieve exclusive updates and our heartfelt thanks for being a major factor in realizing this project!

 Executive Producer: Get credited as executive producer! Recieve exclusive updates and giant, warm thanks from the creators of this project! You are a very big part in making this project a reality!

 Become an NPC: This is also a big one, and will require some effort on your part! Create your own character, either as yourself or let you imagination run wild! 
You decide how your character should look and behave as well as provide an interesting backstory.
We are a small indie team from Gothenburg, Sweden with a shared interest for all things retro. We spend our free time dreaming about games, movies and music.

Carl: Software developer during the day; Game designer, illustrator, animator at night.
Love: Craftsman and multiartist; Composer and sound designer on Invasive Recall.
Oscar: Day job as a software engineer; Game developer and game designer at night.
The game is at this time at about 20% completion. At the rate we are progressing, since all of us have full-time jobs, it will take a long time to complete the project. The money we gather through Kickstarter will make it so that at least one of us can be a full-time developer on this going forward and also increase the time spent on the project by all team members. If we succeed, we think we need 12-16 months to complete the game. We aim to handle the development entirely within our team.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We are aware that making a video game is no easy feat. It is a complicated process with a lot of moving parts and things can go wrong during development. We are however confident that we are up to the task. Having spent the last 6 months working on different parts of the game, we have solved a lot of problems and found a way of working that we feel truly comfortable with. Having said that, unforeseen challenges may always arise, but we are intent on tackling them head on. 
We also feel that community feedback is an important part of making a polished game and are hoping to get backer feedback from the tester reward tier.
We aim to prioritize the quality of the game over delivering on a set date. But are hopeful of a second half of 2022 release.

updates.update_content:
Dear backers,
The campaign has come to an end and let us start by saying how much we appreciate all of your efforts to try and make this campaign reach its goal! We are also very thankful for all your kind words and the valuable feedback we have received during the campaign!
It’s been an exciting ride with both ups and downs. When we launched 4 weeks ago, we had 5 followers on our pre-launch page, and those were the only ones who knew the project even existed. It's safe to say that we were off to a slow start. During the campaign we have had a few spikes and things have periodically looked quite promising. But overall, we lacked a bit of momentum, at least enough to reach the goal with the reward/pricing strategy we had lined up. Unfortunately, we didn’t make it all the way. But together with all of you (over 800!) backers we managed to reach over 24 000 euros, which is pretty cool!

Yesterday was really busy in terms of pledges! At such a rate we could almost reach our goal by a tiny, tiny margin, even if it seems unlikely. Exciting to see such a big jump in numbers in such a short time!
We are very appreciative of all the great ideas and thoughts about the project and how we can improve for a possible second campaign. It’s interesting, even if we don’t reach are goal, we are actually considering this campaign as some what of a success just given how well the project has been received. And we feel that the interest in it really makes it worth pursuing. When we launched the campaign 4 weeks ago, only three people actually knew the project existed, and it was in hindsight way to hastily to launch with such low level of awareness for it. But even so it’s a big contrast going from then to now considering the campaign has over 700 backers!

Dear backers,
Since we are just beyond halfway in terms of funding, we probably need some kind of miracle to make it all the way. This is a bit sad off course, but we have learned a lot during these weeks. One thing being the importance of having a well-planned out campaign. And the execution of it. We have been a little too focused on the game itself and perhaps neglected the importance of campaigning. This is something we think we can do better in the future, if we decide to give it another try. We'll see what happens in the coming days...

Time flies and we are already at the last 7 days of the campaign. Things are looking a bit troublesome at the moment as we are just about 50% towards our goal. It will certainly be a challenge to reach it in time, but let's go for it! :)
We ask that if you like this project, please tell everyone you know who like adventure games, cyberpunk or pixel art, about us and keep spreading the word like you have already!
We are so thankful for all the support and comments we get!

Dear Backers,
We are past the halfway mark. With little under two weeks left of the campaign, we have yet to hit 50% of our goal. It will be a tough two weeks to come. Just want to send out another big thank you to all whom have backed this project and are hoping for it to become a reality as much as we do. You are awesome!
Take care,

Dear backers,
We are 10 days in and have accomplished a third of our goal. Things seem to have picked up some in the last 24 hours or so which is great. We have a long way to go to reach our goal, but a lot can happen in 20 days.
Thanks for all the kind comments about the game. It means a lot to hear that you like what we have showed so far.

campaign.story:
Try the alpha version of the demo on Gamejolt
[NOTE] The game will be translated into English, French, Spanish, and more!
 Contribute to making my dreams of making Aveliana come true!
Before you start reading, why not playing an extract of the main theme soundtrack? 
What is Aveliana?
A few genres in indie videogames are overrepresented such as platformer, Metroidvania, or rogue-like! With Aveliana I want to bring novelty to indie games with fun and original gameplay! Aveliana is an infiltration-action-adventure game!
JUMP INTO THE ADVENTURE AND PLAY THE DEMO ON Gamejolt!. 
Aveliana is a 2.5D game with unique gameplay: based on the detection pattern of enemies, you find your own route through the world. All the enemies can be avoided in the idea of a commandos-like. The gameplay is ultra-dynamic because it is focused on a single character, Aveliana. 
(This trailer was selected as "best indie game trailer" by Best Indie Games!)  
If you feel one path is too complicated or you want to explore a new route, it is always possible to find a secret path, in which the game smoothly transition from 2.5D to a 2D platformer. And if you are tremendous, you can choose to stand and fight your enemies!
The gameplay is constantly renewed in Aveliana thanks to the many enemies that I have crafted for you. Each of them has a different detection and attack pattern. Tall enemies, like robots, can not be directly targeted because they are too tall. However, Aveliana has other tricks in her bag. All along with the game, you will also unlock new abilities to build your character. 
 Don't you love hiding in high-grass?
PLAY

Aveliana is also a game with beautiful environments that you will want to explore to discover all the secrets of the game (and you can contribute to it in some rewards!). Each level has a different environment and atmosphere. Sometimes, after an action-packed sequence, you will have the joy to admire the landscape before continuing the adventure! After a long journey in an environment entirely hand-drawn, you will face fierce and unique bosses!
2.5D / isometric view environments:
2D environments:
 Note: you don't like too difficult games and you just want to know Aveliana's story and discover the levels? No worries, there will be a "story mode" for you! 
The game will be initially released on Steam and will support Windows, Linux and Mac. Later it could be ported to consoles.
Elevator pitch
Aveliana is an action-infiltration-adventure game recognizable by its art design as well as for its fun and unique gameplay!
Embrace Aveliana’s quest to bring back someone she has lost! The game takes place alternatively in an isometric or a 2D point of view and is fast-paced. Guide her through arduous paths watched by monsters, follow the trace of a mysterious fox, and find the powerful artifacts she is looking for at the core of wonderful temples. Will you stealth your way to victory? Seek a forgotten path on the edge of a cliff? Or stand and fight against your enemies? The choice is yours!
 PRESS KIT
What are my inspirations?
Just before starting the game development, I was playing a series of games that probably initiated the thought process in my mind. I played Zelda Breath of the wild, Celeste, Cuphead, Disco Elysium, and finally Children of Morta. I am also inspired by other games such as Gris, Commandos, Rayman origins, and of course Zelda Ocarina of time! Other arts also inspire me, such as painting or music, but also poetry, and anime (in particular Miyasaki's work that I find unique and so poetic!).
What makes Aveliana unique?
The gameplay, the story, and the art style!
2.5D to 2D smooth transition! You can find hidden 2D passages but if you fall, you may fall onto enemies:
PLAY

Unique and diverse stealth gameplay
Precise and fast gameplay for experts (speedrunners!), and adjustable for occasional gamers
A recognizable artistic design
Hand-drawn environments with a lot of variety
A meaningful story with a lot of story twists
Choose your set of skills for the adventure
In Aveliana, at the start of each level, you can reassign your abilities and adapt the set of skills to the upcoming level and to your playstyle. For instance, here the first ability I have chosen (which is the one by default in the demo) is the Dash ability because I like to move quickly, but I could have chosen the Hard skin instead to take less damages. For each slot, you will have to choose between two options! 
Foes in Aveliana 
All enemies in Aveliana have their own detection and attack pattern! The game already has three "common" enemies that detect you with a cone (like the yellow guys in the little video below)! Each of them will be of a different type (melee, zone, ranged)!
Here you can see the new ranged enemy I have just implemented (quite challenging to fight for me):
PLAY

 It also already has 7 unique and more challenging enemies, like the ones below, that will force you to modify your approach and think about your movements! Look at the rewards because you could participate in the development of more enemies like this!
 (this one below you can only see when you are on specific spots where you can activate your medallion)
(that one makes a circle around you and you have to stay in it!)
PLAY

And finally, we have already three unique bosses in the game! One more is programmed!
All this variety in terms of detection and attack patterns is excellent for renewing the gaming experience all along with the game! The enemies can combine in fun and original ways to surprise you at all moments!
What about the story?
While looking for three artifacts, Aveliana will wander a poetic yet dangerous world and discover about her and her environment! As an indie game developer and following my personal thoughts about our world, I wish to use the videogame as a medium to share and carry meaningful messages. As a scientist, what passionate me the most is how a bunch of atoms can come to live, think, eat, love, etc. Aveliana is a strong and reckless bunch of pixels; she is guided by a fox and she starts to understand who she is thanks to him! The whole artistic design, being minimalistic and poetic, has been thought for you to enter into Aveliana’s story and to live a great experience!
[Work in progress] In-game, if you want to get more details about the story, you can use your medallion and scan around to find hidden little NPCs that will give you the precious information:
PLAY

 Who is Thefrenchdev? 
I'm Romain, a French man from La Rochelle (France). I'm 32 and I have started this project at the end of February 2020 and I literally fell in love with game development. Since then, I have been working on Aveliana every day during my free time (from 6 pm to midnight). It has become my passion and the development has gone so well that I have quickly been able to share playable demos with people. This has motivated me, even more, to continue working on it and make it as fun, interesting, and enjoyable as possible.
 I jumped into game development suddenly but I have a background in programming since I am a theoretical physicist and I have painted and drawn all my life. This has helped me a lot during the whole journey since I haven't had to remove any good idea for the game because of technical limitations.
I am doing this project solo but I receive a lot of support and help from my wife, Fanny. We did a lot of brainstorming for the story and we often discuss artistic and gameplay ideas!
They loved the game! 
The Escapist has selected the game for The Escapist Game Showcase!
 Gamejolt has selected Aveliana to be featured as an Indie Gem! "YOU are an indie gem! Really excited to follow along on your progress!" 
The game was selected in a video by Best Indie Games!
All these awesome guys including IndieGameiacs!
 Why I am doing this Kickstarter? 
By backing the project, you can really make it outstanding and support a solo indie dev who put all his heart into it! If the game release is successful, maybe I can make my dream come true and become a game developer! 
First, for the game development, I want to invest in a new computer because the one I am currently using has neither a great GPU nor CPU. This would help me to be more efficient in game making and game testing (which is an important upcoming phase). For now, it suffers a bit when I need to test the game having other software opened (Unity3D, Photoshop, etc.)!
One big reason to kickstart this project is that I would like to raise funds to attend game events and promote the game. I think many beautiful indie games have been forgotten because no one knew they ever existed. Going to such an event costs about 1-2 K$ for the registration fee, the transportation (when we are able to travel again), and a hotel room.
Then I would like to be able to afford to pay the people who are gratefully contributing to the game. I am specifically thinking about game music. I think the music is so great that the composer deserves more than what she is asking for.
I bought a few days ago instruments and tools to make and register music (a workstation, a MIDI controller, a sound card, a DAW software, and an amp)! But who will make this music and why? Well, my wife plays the piano very well and I play guitar so we want to make additional music for the game that will be played procedurally. This means, the current music will be used as intro/outro tracks and for special events in the game and the new music will vary depending on what you do! For instance, if you encounter a lot of enemies, the rhythm and instruments in the track will change. I hope this will create a unique atmosphere and I think I have not seen this kind of thing in a game! I am really excited about it and I will use part of the Kickstarter funds for the things I have bought.
 I really want to make a Switch version for the game, and reaching the main goal and then the stretch goal for it would convince me totally to do it! Plus, I have been accepted (in just 3 days!) as a Switch developer (this means they really loved my project)! I will surely dedicate some funds to the port to this console.
The Kickstarter goal of 12K will greatly help me with this project! It will also unlock the Kraken (a unique mini-boss that I will design, draw, and implement in the game!).
The two stretch goals are important bonuses! The first one is a totally new world and environment for the game that I will draw, design, and implement! This is a mock-up of an environment that I want to create: 
PLAY

 The second stretch goal will unlock the voice-over for the English version! I would love so much to have voices for the game story. 
A new and unique reward!
I have added a new reward called "The music lover" which is unique and is a big support for me! 
For the game, I want to continue working with Ally, who is making awesome tracks, and I want, with my wife, to create new music that will be used during the levels and will be generated procedurally. This means the music will change accordingly to what is happening with smooth transitions. For this, I borrowed some money to pay for a midi keyboard, a sound card and to pay for the 16-tracks version of Bitwig (it is a DAW, a software to create music). All the funds from this reward will be used used to reimburse the instruments and to pay for the upgraded version of Bitwig (I have found some really awesome sounds that can only be used in the "studio edition" and tested (but can't be saved) in the "demo version"). This is why this reward is unique and matters so much for me: it will contribute to an extremely important piece of the game! If you love music and game music this one is for you! You will have access to all the soundtracks that we will make thanks to your contribution and we can discuss about game music during a discussion.
(you can make your design)
BONUS: The music lover is the only one who will be able to add a bonus to his pledge to order a unique Vinyl of Aveliana's soundtracks! The design isn't definitive and because it will be edited only once, you'll be able to choose your image of the game for the cover and the sticker.
Physical rewards! (organic/environment-friendly materials)
I have prepared rewards with a lot of attention and I hope you will love them!
First of all, all ranks have access to a digital version of the game when it will be released!  
 A reward for everyone: If we reach the first Kickstarter goal, I will implement the Kraken into the game! Alongside much other stuff for which you can contribute!
Discover the rewards!
The design of the tote bag and Aveliana's portrait illustration has been done in collaboration with LesPetitsMo who is an awesome french artist I've discovered during the game development! 
The other designs are the artworks I have done for the game. The scene with Aveliana and the fox is my absolute favorite, I have spent 10 hours on it! I also love the T-shirt design with Aveliana surrounded by many little details that correspond to the lore of the game (e.g. the fox, the medaillon). If you choose a reward with an illustration please contact me in order to tell me which one you prefer! (non-definitive designs)
T-shirt (choose your design)

Tote bag (design LesPetitsMo)
Prints (size approx. 21x31 cm)
Contribute to the game creation! 
I have prepared contributive rewards so you can participate in the game making!
Write a piece of text that will be added (on my approval) in the game! 
It can be a side-story, a joke, a quote, a poem, anything you'd like! People will be able to read it in the game and you will be credited in the game! Characters in the game will talk about your legend, or have a laugh when reading your funny joke. I think this is really a unique way of adding your name to the game!
Design a new mini-boss or enemy for the game!
We will discuss and collaborate to make a new and awesome new monster for the game. Your contribution can be either sketch, drawings, animations, or just ideas of an awesome monster that would make the quest of Aveliana even more arduous!

Why doing eco-friendly rewards and at what cost? 
I have decided to make the rewards as respectful as possible of the environment because this is something that matters to me! I also wanted to have good fabric for the T-shirt, tote bag, and high-quality paper and printing for the illustrations. For this, I have decided not to increase the reward prices thus it will slightly reduce the margin I will get from physical rewards. For you, it's all beneficial and I hope you will appreciate it!
 Share the news and join us on social media! 
Since I have started the project, about 7 months ago, I have grown a community of more than 8K followers on Instagram, Twitter, and Discord. This has been an exceptional journey with a lot of awesome feedback. I would love it if you'd like to participate in it, follow me, discuss with me, and make the game even greater than it is right now! And you can find news about the game, about the Kickstarter, about Steam release, etc.
For the launch of the Kickstarter, I am going to start a fanart challenge! There is nothing to earn and it is all for fun (to thank all the artists that are following me)! The last events I organized received the participation of over a hundred people (#thefrenchdevDTIYS on Instagram)!  Check for more info on my social media!
Remember you can wishlist the game on Steam!
THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT! MERCI!
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
There are always risks when doing such a big project alone. However, I have managed to progress a lot already on the game development and there are already many milestones that have been reached (getting a Steam page, making a demo, etc.).

At which stage am I in the project and what is the plan?
Even if this is my first game development project, I think I know from the start where I am going and what is the scope of the game. This has helped me to always be on time with my schedule, and even be in advance on many aspects (for instance the IA of the game is already done, the game mechanics and the physics is coded, I have already about 18 levels that are completed and ready for polishing, etc.).
I have started the game development on the 23rd of February and after about 1 month, I have started to send versions to people on my social media so they could try it and give me feedback. I got a lot of positive feedback and bugs to solve. After 2 months of game development, I have proposed a "pre-alpha mockup" on Gamejolt, which has been played more than 250 times! I received a ton of really good feedback and this demo was stable. Then I focused on doing a real demo for the game, the one you can find now on Gamejolt. This version is a glimpse at what will be the game in terms of story, art design, gameplay...

Now for the next 6 months, I want to focus on drawing all the levels of the game (about 25 for about 6-7 hours of estimated gameplay). On the fly, I will of course add new enemies, implement the story, and add features (such as unlocking new abilities for Aveliana). After this, I will enter the final phase of the game development and during the last 6 months, I will focus on polishing everything. Playtest the game a lot and finish the drawings, animations, cutscenes...

I think I can say now that the game will be finished because the project is sufficiently advanced and I see where I am going with it. All the stages have been completed ahead of time until now. 
The current version of the game is playable and stable, it is just too short and it doesn't carry yet the story I want to tell! This Kickstarter can really help me to do even more stuff for the game and reach another level of quality!
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_userinfo: Aveliana is ready for the next Steam festival!
updates.update_content:
Physical rewards are almost ready to send!
Hi everyone! A short update to let you know that I am now ordering all the rewards, I delayed by 2 weeks in order to be sure to have a maximum of answers to the rewards forms. I have decided to purchase the rewards at a local company, I hope you will like them! For my particular designs, the company told me that I have to print them on a white or cream-colored T-shirt, I think it will look totally awesome! 
Steam festival

Hello everyone,
I do a little update to keep you informed about the game progress. Remember that the best way to follow the game dev is on https://twitter.com/TheFrenchDev_ ! Feel free to DM me over there if you need information. I am sharing news on a daily basis.
A lot of additions

It has now been one month since the campaign is finished! I hope you are all following the progress on my social media, I have seen that many of you joined the Discord channel, which is amazing. I am currently preparing the digital kit so all backers who supported me and who choose this reward will soon receive a notification on Kickstarter with the link to download it! Later on, I will start preparing the physical rewards and send you forms for them. I have also sent the form for beta-testers so that the beta-testing phase will start soon!
A new mini-boss made in collaboration with one of the backers!

Just in time, the project was funded this morning (yesterday at midnight when I was already having a good sleep)! And with the great last day's blast, we reached more than 120% so it is almost the first stretch goal (which is a totally new biome for the game!). Thank you so much I have put a lot of effort into this campaign and now I see it is worth it! This is the last update on the campaign during its "LIVE" period, I know I've told you yesterday's one was the last but I think I'm going to miss that! I will do other updates later to inform you about the game progress and you can always share with me on Instagram, Twitter, and Discord where many of you will receive a role! In just 15 days, I will celebrate with you the 1 year of Aveliana and her lovely fox!

updates.update_userinfo: Get ready for the final day!
updates.update_content:
I want to thank you all!
We've made it (well technically we are at 99% as I am writing this ;)) and I want to thank you so much for all your pledges! As a solo developer, it is a real honor to be part of the Kickstarted projects! Today I have received more than 800€ in 12 hours, let's make it skyrocketing! Enough for the stats, THANK YOU SO MUCH, we still have an amazing day to come and it is possible that we even reach the first stretch goal! I am so glad I've made it with no PR, no editor, just love, the trust of awesome backers and of content creators (really thank you all guys for all the streams you have offered to me!), and motivation!

updates.update_userinfo: Entering in the money time of the campaign, only 4 days left to back the project!
updates.update_content:
It is now the last 4 days of the campaign and I am really excited about it because I think the goal will be met! This is quite exceptional for a 100% solo dev (and also driving the Kickstarter campaign alone). I got so much great news in the last two days (since the last update) including great streams, loads of new pledges, approval from Nintendo (see below)! In the last two days, 10% of the project has been backed! And it's just 15% remaining now! Thank you so much, keep pushing for it!
Accepted as a Nintendo Switch dev!

The campaign is still going on very well! Yesterday, I got two new pledges over 200€ and a lot of other pledges! Thank you so much for helping me bring to life Aveliana and her lovely fox companion! If you haven't, don't forget to make your contribution.
This is a drawing challenge is still running! Check my Instagram account for more info!

updates.update_userinfo: One week left! The goal is near!
updates.update_content:
8 days left! 
MERCI, THANKS, GRACIAS (these are the three languages I know :)) GRAZIE, ESKERRIK ASKO, DANKE, OBRIGADO (for those I don't need google translate), etc.
I realized that going 100% alone on a Kickstarter campaign isn't that common, and succeeding is even less! This is really a lot of work and stress but I'm really happy to be that close to the goal! , you are making my day (and more you are making this project real!).

updates.update_userinfo: Almost 2/3 of the project is funded, 12 days left!
updates.update_content:
Currently, almost 2/3 of the project is backed thanks to all of you! I really wish we can make it quickly to the goal and maybe reach some stretch goals in the final days! I want to thank everyone and in particular, the ones who backed for over 100 euros this week (3 more than 800!). 
As you know, I am working solo on this campaign and it makes the whole thing really exciting and very demanding compared to projects handled by a marketing team or a publisher. I am extremely motivated by the feedback I receive about the project.

campaign.story:
Decline's Drops is a game about a wooden puppet who didn't want her garden to be destroyed.

Features:
Discover a poetic, vibrant and somehow melancholic universe in a classic side-scrolling, hand-drawn adventure. 
Travel through 6 beautiful worlds including 8 stages each, full of collectibles and things to explore!
 Defend yourself with your powerful gloves using a wide range of attacks, allowing you to adapt to each and every situation! 
Avenge your garden by defeating all of the 6 Hydra heads and reveal the true reason behind the apparition of the Decline.
 Tons of collectibles: Alternate colors for Globule, new moves, cards for the bestiary...
TARGET PLATFORMS: PC, MAC, NINTENDO SWITCH
 JOIN DECLINE'S DROPS DISCORD SERVER 
LANGUAGE SUPPORT: ENGLISH, GERMAN, JAPANESE, FRENCH CONFIRMED
 PRESS KIT 
Click here to download and play the demo!

In another world, in another time, there lived , far far away from  everyone, from everything, a little puppet who was taking care of her  garden, watching days and nights pass, quietly. 
In another world, in another time, there came the "Decline", followed by  the appearance of a six-headed Hydra. A torrential, purple rain fell on  the puppet's island, destroying the beloved garden and drastically  changing the environment. Strange buildings emerged from nowhere,  species disappeared, being replaced by odd frogs and other creatures.
In another world, in another time, the puppet put her gloves on,  determined to find those responsible for this horrible mess. But who  knows where this will lead her...?

Decline's Drops is a beautiful hand-drawn 2D platform-brawler, taking inspiration from the greatest video game classics to create a unique and unforgettable experience. Each world, each character has been meticulously designed and crafted, made with love, passion, and care. Embracing the level design mastery of Yoshi's Island, Kirby's Adventure  or Shovel Knight, Decline's Drops merges it with the satisfying gameplay  of the Super Smash Bros. series in a solo focused adventure, full of  chickens and frogs to punch, things to explore, and secrets to find!
Dive into 6 worlds, each one of them being a subtle satire of our own world.  From the destruction of the environment to the exploitation of the  animals, through the pollution of the seas and the impacts of high  consumerism, Decline's Drops, without being a moral speech, has a lore  focused on these different aspects of society. This also allows a great  diversity regarding the level design, which is something we'll talk  about later.
In Decline's Drops, you'll travel through old-school crafted worlds,  each and every element being placed for an intended and specific  purpose. Following the rules of the greatest game/level designers,  everything has a role to play. The drops you collect give you HP  bonuses, but also allow you to buy things at the shop. Defeating enemies  will grant you more power, but beware: if you're hit by them, you lose  that power!
Unlike other platformers, Decline's Drops has a gameplay focused on  combat: Globule has a wide range of various attacks adapted to every  situation. From the classic jab to the powerful back air, enemies will  make you use every one of them! But wait, there’s more: as you progress  through your adventure, Globule will learn new special moves, such as a grab-&-throw attack, the Super Punch or the almighty GLOVE. These  special moves will allow you to reach new horizons and will greatly help  you during tough fights.
Mini-games, mid-bosses that block your way, submarine gloves, Arcimboldo tanks... Decline's Drops will offer great diversity, a strong and solid gameplay being the main focus.
This is the current World Map. Design is subject to change.
As mentioned before, each world is a satirical portrayal of some aspects of our society. Let's take a look at some of them:
FORMER FIELDS
Concept Art - Former Fields
The first World of Decline's Drops. This place used to be a peaceful  land but with the arrival of the Decline, everything started to change  and is no longer what you see above.
As you'll progress through the game, you'll notice how much the Decline has an impact on the world Globule lives in.
Petroleum Port
Rainy and stormy, Petroleum Port always has been quite a dark place. The Decline added a vast, sticky black sea, swarming with mouldy Frogmos all over the place. In its deepest abyss lurk mysterious and dangerous  foes... In other words, watch out.
Vanitas
All is vanity and chasing after the wind.
Vanitas stages are... Specials. 
Worlds of gold, emerald, poison and strange gold monuments, the Vanitas world is quite an ominous one. Time seems to be stopped and you feel something, or someone is watching you, wherever you are...
Vanitas stages are the hardest ones in Decline's Drops. They'll test your skill at a high level, so you'd better be prepared. There's actually a hidden Vanitas stage in the Kickstarter demo. Give it a try... If you dare.
You'll find one Vanitas level in each world, and you'll be able to access them after fulfilling certain conditions.
Globule
Globule is the main character and hero of Decline's Drops. She is a mouthless wooden puppet with the cutest poker face you could imagine (yes, it is possible). Nonetheless, she seems to be able to eat as it is one of the few things she really enjoys. Globule aspires to nothing but tranquility, and when that tranquility is in danger, she has her gloves  who give her an incredible ability at convincing people to appear  more... "friendly".
 Eternal Corp. & the Six Hydra's heads 
Endless growth. Endless possibilities.
Behind the events of Decline's Drops, there is a name, and that name is  the Eternal Corporation. They created - or have been created by - the  Decline, have made most of the Frogmos, and their desire is to grow,  more and more, endlessly. The Eternal Corporation is managed by only one member, Cortupiro. But the thing is, Cortupiro is a Hydra, and as a Hydra, Cortupiro’s body has six heads, and yet somehow has managed to detach its heads and give them unique bodies so they could focus on their own tasks.
Ravage
Ravage is the least intelligent head. As the ruler of the Former Fields, his task is to produce more and more crops using the tools coming from the Laboratory. Unbeknownst to him, these "tools" have also had an  impact on his own health, and as a result, a second little head has started to grow on him. Sick and weak-minded, he's easily upset and  aggressive when things don't go the way he wants.
Mutorpeel
Obscure and silent, Mutorpeel hides its sagging body in the deep ocean,  spreading dark, viscous pieces of itself all over the sea. Its task is  unknown, and nobody knows if it’s even aware of what it is doing.
The Frogmos
Concept art of upcoming Frogmos.
Consequences or creations of the Eternal Corp., Frogmos are everywhere  on the Island. Somehow adapted to their environment, Frogmos are  unwillingly hostile creatures, most of the time. Tiny or gigantic,  ominous or pathetic, they will block Globule’s path at every corner.
Every animation in Decline's Drops is hand drawn, frame by frame. There is no limit with traditional animation,allowing great expressiveness and giving unique personnality to each element in the game.
Globule's Up Air animation process

We've got lots and lots of different rewards for those who want to support our project! Please take a look on the right to see what you can get. Thanks to our collaboration with First Press Games, we are able to offer many great physical rewards, including beautiful boxes with leather-like slipcases, numerated and collector coins, Artbooks, CD soundtrack, and even a Globule plush!
As a bonus, each backer of a physical reward will receive a bronze collector coin! Isn't that great?

ABOUT THE ADD-ONS:
Do you want the digital version of Decline's Dros for PC, but also want a marvelous plush of Globule? Pretty simple: just add the cost of one of the add-on (see prices below) to your final pledge! As with any other physical reward, please note the price does not include shipping cost and this will be considered later with First Press Games.
LIST OF ADD-ONS:
PC/MAC digital download : 10€
NINTENDO SWITCH digital download : 15€
NINTENDO SWITCH REGULAR EDITION PHYSICAL COPY: 40€ (FOR 50€ BACKERS AND ABOVE ONLY)
NINTENDO SWITCH LIMITED EDITION PHYSICAL COPY: 110€ (FOR 120€ BACKERS AND ABOVE ONLY)
FULL CD Soundtrack : 20€ ~ $24
Hardcover Artbook : 25€ ~ $30
Globule Plush : 25€ ~ $30
You will be contacted later after the end of the Kickstarter so we can know what you want. 

IMPORTANT NOTE : As for the tiers involving your participation, please note that you should contact us at : moulin.aux.bulles@gmail.com BEFORE you pledge, so we can discuss about your idea and see if it can be done.
Also please consider that the physical rewards pledges DO NOT INCLUDE shipping prices. This will be considered later. (9€ - 12.50€ in Europe, 10€ - 20€ internationally).
Music & Audio
Now, for my favorite part! A great soundtrack is one of the most  important things in a video game. Soundtracks composed by Koji Kondo,  Hiroki Kikuta, Manami Matsumae or Toby Fox are some great examples.  Decline's Drops's soundtrack is created by the great ModalModule, an  incredibly talented and versatile artist. Owner of the "ModalEffect",  that power grants him the ability to create music that only gets better  the more you listen to it. Have no doubt, check it out by yourself:
On the other side, SFX will be created by Pixel Audio, who have proven their talent at making powerful sounds in various games such as Jotun, Lara Croft GO and Spiritfarer.
There's also a whole bunch of great musicians that will bring their talent to Decline's Drops. I did some of the songs in the game too.
About that guy...
Now I guess it's the moment where I have to show off, right? Well...
Hello, hi, good morning, good evening, "bonjour". The name is Marc,  Drazglb. or Rubix' Man, I'm 25 and I am the creator of Decline's Drops.  Passionate video game lover, my childhood was filled with the enchanted  worlds of Nintendo games, but also Crash Bandicoot, Spyro, and many more. One night, just as I was about to fall in the arms of Morpheus, the image of  a little character with big, blue gloves appeared right in front of me .  From this moment I knew I had to make my own game, a game I would really enjoy myself. Without any knowledge, I started to learn how to  code and animate. Making a game is such a great experience and a unique  way to express myself. I won't stop anytime soon!

First Press Games
We have the chance to collaborate with First Press Games who specialize in providing great and unique physical game releases, making it possible to offer beautiful boxes, good old manuals, and obviously goodies, like CD soundtracks, wonderful collector coins and even plushes right from the start of this Kickstarter! We know how important physical versions of video games are (we do love them ourself) and that's exactly what First Press Games helps us to offer. They will also assist me with the console publishing in general.
Decline's Drops started out as a hobby project less than two years ago,  and somehow it still is. My current situation allows me to focus on the  game's development during my free time, but this is only for a matter of  time. I have a family and I can't keep going on this way forever. To be more precise, I won't have the opportunity to work on Decline's Drops if I have another job. 
I've been thinking about it a lot and Kickstarter seems to be the best  way to create Decline's Drops the way I would want, without any  constraints. It is also a great way to communicate with you, and as a backer of several projects myself, I love the concept of rewards! 
Your support will allow me to spend all of my time working on the  project without being afraid for the future of my family. With your  support, I will be able to pay the talented artists working on the  soundtrack and the SFX who will dedicate their time to provide you the  best experience possible!
At this stage, the first world is almost done. There's still a lot of things to draw, stages to design, but the scenario is complete, and I know exactly where I am going. If everything goes well, the game should be released for the end of the year 2021 or early 2022.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
This is a Kickstarter project, so, by definition, it implies some risks. I also totally understand that my lack of experience can look very risky, to say the least. That is why I released a demo 3 months ago, and seeing the incredible amount of great feedback, it seems my work has some great potential. If you're unsure about this, check out the latest demo; what you'll see in it is basically a less enhanced version of what will be in the final product.
I am also very picky and critical regarding my work, as well as passionate, and I believe this is a guarantee of the quality of the project. I'll do everything I can to provide a game of great quality.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

updates.update_content:
Happy new year everyone! I hope you had great holidays even in these weird times. I wish you all the best health possible!

As I said in the previous update, I took some really needed vacations to take a step back from Decline's Drops. I've been watching many videos of people playing the game, listened to your feedbacks, took some time to see how I can improve the gameplay, the level design, etc... There are lots of new things to consider, some aspects of the game that I have to improve, change, modify, hopefully for the better.  From now on Decline's Drops enter in a new phase of development, thanks to you it's a very "serious" thing now (see my serious face) so I had to elaborate my strategy. A Kickstarter project is funded based on confidence, on trust, and I want to take care of that trust you gave me. While I'll be less consistent than I used to regarding the frequency of my updates (because more work now, and we have to keep some things secrets, right?), I'll publish a new update every month so you know how the game is going. If you have some questions, don't hesitate to contact me, I'll answer your questions as soon as possible.

campaign.story:
Missed the main campaign?
               PLEDGE ON SLACKER BACKER!  

Click me!
Animation by Fable Siegel
 Billie Bust Up is a musical 3D platformer inspired by Disney musicals, with memorable unique villains and singing bosses, we’ve entwined the gameplay into the music 
Each main character has their own song that sells their personality, motives, and charm. Up to 15 unique songs by Daniel Ingram! 
The lyrics serve as a telegraph for the gameplay
Attacks drop to the beat of the music with rhythm-based battles 
Music adapts to the way you play
Different gameplay experiences and battles for each song to engage the player in new and more interesting ways, as to not get repetitive
 A large and unique cast of characters, each with their own backstories, personalities, and charm 
 A cheerful and cute exterior masking a deeper and darker story 
Optional sing-a-long mode for every song
 Accessible! We think it’s important for everyone to have the chance to play, read our full list of features here 
Optional local split-screen co-operative gameplay between Billie and Oscar
After learning that she has incredible magic powers that she inherited from her father, Billie was made an apprentice of the amazing Aristotle, the Axolotl, who will mentor her throughout the game and teach her new spells. Billie has a wide range of skills. 
Glide
Using magic Billie can use a low-level telekinesis spell, letting her glide slowly to the ground with the help of her trusty umbrella wand. 
Broom Brolly
Billie extends her closed umbrella into a broomstick and rides around on it for extra speed, it can glide over hazards such as lava, water, quicksand, and more. 
Umbrella Shield
Billie’s umbrella creates a shield around her, it has its own health bar. It restores its health over time if it is not in use. It will start to crack as its health depletes. When Billie releases her shield it makes a small shockwave that pushes enemies back, the strength of the shockwave depends on how much HP remains on the shield. 
 Water Brolly
When opened, it can rain inside Billie’s umbrella. The rainwater regrows grass in the spots where Oscar has been digging. It can put out fires, help grow seeds, and turn lava into a temporary rock platform. 
Invisi-billie-ty
Billie is temporarily invisible and can only be seen by enemies with heat vision goggles. Her invisibility will be removed if damaged or if the endurance meter runs out. The meter refills when the skill is not in use.
 Flight 
Billie grows wings formed from magic! Using a strong telekinesis spell she can lift herself into the air with short bursts of magic. She can flap 3 times for extra height and glide in between.
 Magic Decoy
Billie will summon a personalized item that will distract its target, however, the item will be only effective for a limited time period. 
Umbrella Bounce
Oscar can bounce off Billie’s umbrella when it is open, this includes when she is gliding. Billie can also open her umbrella on the ground and is fully mobile when using it but cannot use abilities.  
Dig
Oscar’s dig move will leave a pair of holes at the entry and exit points that serve as a teleport. There can be 3 sets of holes at a time, both Billie and Oscar can use them.
Freeze
Billie pulses out a frost shockwave that freezes enemies and water within its radius. Billie can freeze any nearby water to create temporary platforms of ice. 
Smell-o-vision
See important items, allies, and enemies, through walls. The controller will begin vibrating if close to a buried item and will vibrate more violently the closer the player is to an item. The controller will pulse vibrate when ready to dig.
Rewind
Billie, and Billie ALONE, travels backward through time. Can be used for puzzles or to recover from platforming mistakes. Holding down the key rewinds Billie, releasing the key stops the rewind. 
There will be many different Outfits for you to collect for both Billie and Oscar. These can either be sold by local vendors in exchange for your hard earned Bells or found in the world by exploring and solving puzzles.
Yes you can! Pamper your best friend in Oscar's Petting Game. You can wash him when he gets dirty, feed him treats, unlock new toys and costumes and much more. Check out the video below for an early preview of what to expect in the full game.
PLAY

We will be releasing on Steam and offering DRM free copies on PC. Whilst we want to release on all consoles, this can be hard with a limited budget. We have been approved for Switch developer access, but we cannot promise this until we have the game running on test consoles. However, if we can guarantee a platform release you may change your digital copy to the confirmed console of your choice!
Current community members of Billie Bust Up know that the characters are the bread and butter of this game, boasting tons of personality, each one is dear to us. Their backstories have been fully fleshed out, and each villain gets a song by Daniel Ingram to compliment their aesthetic and to their motive and personality. The heroes will also get their own songs to truly make this a musical adventure.
There are four major villains' in total, from left to right we have Fantoccio the puppet, Dutch the wolf, Elaine the cat pirate Queen and Barnaby the party ghost owl. Each worlds theme has a unique flair and concept to keep the gameplay interesting and fun.
Billie and Oscar
Billie's voice is by Amber May! Her voice has previously featured in Pokemon Journeys as Camille, Kemono Friends, and Vindictus.
Aristotle the Axolotl
Aristotle is a wandering traveler, talented and knowledgeable in the ways of magic, a true mentor figure! They pitch up a tent in the enchanted forest an recruit Billie as a magic protégé. 
Watch the fully voiced storyboard of Aristotle below. Aristotle is voiced by Edward Bosco, best known for his work as Alastor in Hazbin Hotel and Ed in SFV. 
PLAY

The Treehouse 
Billie and her friends, Lou and Lily, spend a lot of their time inside the treehouse, serving as one of Billie’s main hubs throughout the game.
Elaine’s level is a sprawling large cat pirate city, with lots of places to climb and explore. A lot of the designs for the buildings were based around cat toys, and there are plenty of hidden cat faces around the map, can you spot them all? 
 You've found yourself a prisoner to the Cat Pirate Queen Elaine, in an attempt to find the secrets to your magic-wielding abilities.     
 Billie sets out on her very first mission, is immediately captured by cat pirates, and taken prisoner by the terrifying Captain Elaine. Now, she must escape, and steal the gem back from the pirates! This level contains stealth segments and a giant cat pirate city to explore.   
View Elaine’s voiced storyboard below! Elaine's voice is provided by Melissa Medina! Previous work includes playing Mindy from Holofist and Lucy von Deita on Wild Card.
PLAY

Billie has managed to convince Dutch, owner of a renowned hotel, to give her a job. Juggle working under the direction of Hayes in this lavish establishment and finding the powerful gem Dutch is hiding! 
View Dutch’s voiced storyboard below! His voice is provided by Uncle Ali! Best known for his work as DJ Subatomic Supernova from No Straight Roads!
reference sheet for Dutch
PLAY

Barnaby, the ghost owl, is hosting a forever party, and you're the newest guest! Trouble is, there's a token fee for mortals to join. Beat Barnaby at his own games and escape his party castle with his gem... and your life! 
Reference sheet for Barnaby
View Barnaby's voiced storyboard below, fully voiced by Gabriel C. Brown (BlackGryph0n), best known for his impression work on YouTube, along with providing his singing voice for the songs No Mercy and Beep Beep Like a Sheep
PLAY

 A musical boss fight and finale, the players' choices will impact the last Act as they direct their own play by picking prop sets, outfits, and scripts.
Fantoccio, the theatre-loving puppet, has spent 15 years locked away in this enchanted theatre, waiting for the perfect play-thing to come along. Can Billie put up with his theatrical antics, find the gem, and annoy him into letting her go? 
Fantoccio is an extremely egotistical puppet with a napoleon complex and a flair for the dramatic. 
He has a short temper and will snap if provoked, especially when mocked about his short stature or name. He enjoys character roleplay and acting and will often dress up as multiple characters in his plays as he rarely wants to share the spotlight.   
View Fantoccio’s voiced storyboard below! Fantoccio's voice is provided by Michael Kovach! Previous work includes playing Angel Dust on Hazbin Hotel and Rocky from Lackadaisy, the animated short.
PLAY

Billie Bust Up is a musical game, and naturally the music is extremely important. You can hear some examples of the environmental music below, composed by the very talented Gooseworx. Examples demonstrated here are for the cat pirate level, The Goat Escape.
There are plenty of good rewards for pledging to our Kickstarter, a lot being exclusive to Kickstarter itself. Once the stock runs out, it will be gone forever. From pins, to plushies, to drawn pieces of concept art, you can also feature inside the game itself as an NPC, or help us create a boss battle! (musical song not included) Below are some prototypes and examples of what to expect!
Exclusive Skins
You can pick from a line up of exclusive skins , only on Kickstarter! £3 for any skin via an add-on, one is included free in the Digital bundle, and 4 are included for the digital deluxe pack! Our current line up includes special villian skins for Billie that gives her a custom idle and unique responses from the villains.
Fantoccio is unamused
Looking cute in a Barnaby onesie!
Pins 
T-Shirts
Plushies
BETA Access
You will receive access to each chapter as it is polished and ready! meaning you don't have to wait for release day! Some aspects may still change from the BETA to the full release.

ALPHA Access
Access to every single Patreon build until launch! You'll watch as each level goes from block out to polish. Play through the game with storyboards, and roughs, have input and feedback into the final game, and watch as the game grows and changes. Piano demos to final vocals and orchestration, the works! 

Thanks to Kickstarter we have official add-ons! Customize your tier here with the below prices.


 Our game has been planned out from start to finish. Each mission and script laid out with a cost and a project plan, we know exactly how much this game will take to make. Most of our budget thus far has come from grants and self funding, which we have put into polishing Fantoccios boss fight, his song and design. We doubt we can hit the games full budget in one Kickstarter and will seek external funding for the rest of our goal.

We don’t want to extend our current scope past what we’ve already planned for the game, but we’ve laid out the breakdown above for each levels cost. The more we fund and unlock the less we need to get from investors, making it easier to fund but also letting us keep a bigger percentage of the game! We plan to make the entire game regardless, this is a intense passion project, but the more money here we get the easier the process will be and the better quality work we can deliver!


Billie Bust Up has been a passion project of ours for almost 3 years now. Starting as a game jam it slowly grew in popularity and our vision expanded with it. We wanted to make something we were proud of, and last year we restarted the project when we discovered our USP, making the game a musical! A lot of our team members started out as members of the community first and have a great passion for the game and what they do. We can't be more thankful for everyone's support thus far, and hope you'll stick around for the rest of the journey!  So, let's meet the people behind the game!
 We have planned out every single cost exactly, a lot of money goes into the music, art, animation and design. Our current estimated release date is 2024, as we want to produce a high quality game that we can be proud of. Our team is small but trusted, and we are cautious to expand above our means.  However, we have been extremely open via our funding on Patreon, and on Discord throughout our development and will continue to do so here as well! 
 Backers at the alpha and beta testing tiers will be able to play the game as we work on it also. 
 We’ve been approached by several interested publishers and investors, but all of them have repeated the same critique, that our game simply doesn’t have enough content outside of the boss fight to risk investment. We spent a lot of our funds and time working below minimum wage to produce Fantoccio’s boss fight as a proof of concept for our unique selling point. Along with perfecting the platforming mechanics to be precise, tight, and fun to play within an empty room. Although Billie Bust Up has been in concept for 3 years, it’s only been a year in development, with us scrapping most of our old work back in 2019 when we fully realized what we wanted from this game and its story.
We have been fortunate to receive support in the form of several grants and scholarships, along with the help of our community over on Patreon. However, this money has been drip-fed slowly as to keep James and Katie working full time on the project, but this meant next to no money left over to spend on hiring additional staff to help with concept art, particle effects, music, etc. We want to make a big push on funding to get the game to a point in which we can receive external funding.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
We want to do this game right, it is extremely important to us that the game reaches our vision and personal goals for quality, thus our team is quite small. We work with people who are equally passionate about the game and that we can trust to do a good job. As a result, production is slow but mitigates any risk of slippage when working with unknown contractors.

We have been active on social media and updated our Patreon frequently, and have a good track record inside the community. We will keep you informed throughout development.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter

campaign.story:
Wishlist on Steam | Website | Follow us on Twitter | Patreon | Spotify Playlist 
Dive into the 1950s and explore an eldritch-horror-infested world soaked in dark magic, mystery, and romance. Call Me Under takes place in the mysterious underwater city of Styx, a haven inhabited by humans, sirens, and a host of unknown otherworldly entities. 
This is our first non-episodic project and will be released as a full game. We are aiming for a Fall/Q4 2021 release on Steam, itch.io, and Nintendo Switch (eShop). 
Call Me Under is rated Mature 17+ for strong language, sexual themes, dark humor, violence, body horror/blood, and eldritch horrors.
Play as a choice of two different faceless protagonists from The Surface seeking to leave their past behind and start fresh in a new city, even if it is one only rumored to exist at the bottom of the ocean. They do say there's nothing like a clean slate...
But maybe not if you find yourself thrown into the middle of a brewing fight between the Shadows and the Light; two ancient, otherworldly entities embroiled in a centuries-long battle for power. 
Like any city, Styx's heart is its most ancient place. Neighborhoods sprawling outward from that 'heart' have gradually taken on more modern, reassuringly mundane appearances, but the abyss where its most ancient lives once began is a dark, deep, and ruined place. Grand cathedrals now have fallen to disrepair, the entities they once honored forgotten to time. Rundown cobblestone streets where only peculiar, adapted lichen and moss provide light. Shadows, eerily like people and not quite, flit to and fro.
Discover and unlock new areas around the city.
Even in the more well-lit and recent parts of Styx, the ghosts linger. Those who died were wrapped up and sent out to the sea to be given back to the depths but, unfortunately, not everyone 'leaves'. Ghosts coexist with the living, looking like they belong until you look too hard. Coy sirens patrol — or perhaps infest — the waters outside of Styx’s beautiful glass tunnels. Every Friday, like clockwork, the cheerful mayor’s voice booms over the announcement system...
"What a beautiful day to be in the safe embrace of Styx!"
Our story begins on a night that will change the lives of everyone in Styx. Something significant. You’ll feel a shift in the current and discover that the ripple-effect won’t stop until you find the source. 
In our demo, you will play as The Human; one of our two protagonists. You felt the quake, saw a vision of a stranger covered in blood, and now the city seems to whisper to you. Dark magic is at play here, and you’ll need to seek out the blood-soaked man before you can feel any relief from the voices that call out to you.  
Player Roles
We have two player characters for you to choose from when starting the game: The Human and The Skia. Each character comes with a different background and, depending on who you choose, a different journey throughout Styx. 
Your path will be determined by the choices you make as you unravel the secrets of the city, and you will also influence those around you depending on if you lean towards the Shadows, or if you'd rather seek out the Light. 
Human or Half-Siren? Both will lead you on different journeys...
The Human
Having recently arrived from The Surface, you find yourself thrust into the capable hands (and employment) of Penelope Sinclair; Editor of the Styx Journal, but most significantly leader of Scott & Sinclair investigations. Your past is shady, but your convictions are nothing but a memory here in Styx. Call it a much-needed new beginning, if you will. A second chance to start somewhere fresh where nobody knows your name. You have a job, a place to live, and a host of shit that's about to be thrown into your lap. Here's hoping your sea legs are steady because life is about to get real choppy. Settling into a new city can be a real headache...
In choosing The Human, you will find yourself in the grasp of the Shadows. You will be guided by Blue Kastor.
The Skia 
Your story began long before you came into this world when your relatives escaped the watery grip of Styx through unknown means to escape to The Surface. The call of the Shadows, however, is inescapable for a half-blood like you. It swells in you like a deafening melody, calling you home. Back into the sea and into the place that the Light can't reach. Into Styx.  Headaches and other whispers your mind can't decipher plague you, but your soul remembers. Fortunately, your arrival was as expected as it was ordained, and you were able to get a place to live and a job with Penelope Sinclair as a rookie journalist, and you've been able to forget that you aren't necessarily here of your own free will. However, you'll need to wake up soon and start asking questions before the deep starts to consume you... 
In choosing The Skia, you will find yourself in the grasp of the Light. You will be guided by Adrien Navarre.
Oh, the yearning... (Adrien & Blue)
Love Interests
Styx is host to a number of interesting characters, from a jaded private investigator to a cryptic medium, you're sure to find someone that piques your interest. We have six individual romances and you can also play the game without entering a romance.   
There will be clearly marked options when it comes to more intimate choices for those who wish to avoid that, and we also have two polyamorous routes; Callie + Penny, and Blue + Adrien. Call Me Under is our very first voiced game too, with all of our love interests—plus one non-romanceable character—having incredible voice actors to bring them to life.
Robbie Daymond is a Native-American Voice Artist, Actor, and Performer based in Los Angeles. He works in Anime, western animation, commercials, film, television, audiobooks, and videogames. His work is featured in projects such as Final Fantasy XV, Persona 5, Fire Emblem: Three Houses, and Sailor Moon. Twitter | Website
Allegra Clark is a Los Angeles-based trilingual actor and voiceover artist. Allegra's work is featured in projects such as Dragon Age Inquisition, Apex Legends, Fire Emblem: Three Houses, and JoJo's Bizarre Adventure. Twitter | Website
Farah Naz Rishi is a non-binary (she/they) Pakistani American voice actor, screenwriter, and author of the young adult novels I Hope You Get This Message and the forthcoming It All Comes Back to You. Twitter | Website
Noshir Dalal is an American actor and performer. His work has featured in projects such as Sekiro, Red Dead Redemption II, Death Stranding, Ghost of Tsushima, and The Outer Worlds. Twitter | Website
Tracy Ifeachor is a British theatre, film, and television actor. Her projects include Doctor Who, Quantico, Star Wars: The Old Republic - Knights of the Eternal Throne, and many more.
Stephen Fu is a professional voice actor known for his work in anime and video games such as My Hero Academia and Granblue Fantasy Versus. Twitter | Website
Alejandro Saab is a Latino and Lebanese voice actor and performer who has worked on projects such as Fire Emblem: Three Houses, Final Fantasy VII Remake, Dragonball Legends, and Pokemon Journeys. Twitter | Website
Choose wisely.
Explore
During certain portions of the game, you'll be able to decide who you visit, but choose wisely, because you can't pick them all. Certain areas and interactions may help your journey more than others, so decide if you want to trust your head or your heart. 
Put on your thinking cap...
Investigate 
You might work for Penny as a reporter at the Styx Journal by day, but by night you assist her with the growing missing person's cases that are plaguing the city. As the story progresses ‘The Missing‘ will pile up, and it's down to you to gather as much information as you can about who they were, and where the hell they went. Our interactive case board will help you keep track of that information, and you can add evidence that you find along the way.
Egan's disappearance sets our whole story in motion.
Codex and Audio Logs
Our codex will have multiple sections for stories and lore, but the most fun feature we're adding to this section is our audio logs. Speak to characters and investigate areas to retrieve tapes voiced by our actors to further assist your cases. 
A quiet morning with Callie & Penny
Character Relationships
Access your case file from the menu to view your relationships with our main characters, including a special page area for whoever you choose to romance. Do they trust you? Do they kind of want to fight you or kiss you? Only time (and your actions) will tell! 
Collectibles and Keepsakes
When you return home, you’ll be able to view your collection of keepsakes and collectibles that you gather along the way. Be it a simple business card or an unwanted crystal, or maybe even a gift from the object of your affection. Decide if these items are important enough to turn in as evidence to your investigations, or if you need to keep them to yourself... 
The Doctor will see you now.
Multiple 'Good' and 'Bad' Endings
With two different player roles and eight romances, there are a number of potential outcomes to your Call Me Under experience. At Lunaris Games, we don't believe in always being 'the hero' because, well...being 'evil' is kind of sexy, actually. With the conflicting forces of good and evil constantly pulling at you throughout the story, it's down to you to decide which side you'll take. But beware, some of our love interests aren't down to dance with the Devil, so you might have to break some hearts if yours tells you to walk into the dark. 
PLAY

Soundtrack  
We will have a selection of original songs by London-based composer, Dorrell Ettienne.  He has composed our official theme for the demo which you can listen to above. 
Welcome Pack
The essentials to get you started in your life in Styx. Includes: 'The Incredible Eve' mini print by Nadine Lawton, and two mini prints of our poly couples by Kholoud Al Ejily. Prints are A5 (210mm X 148mm) and printed on uncoated, 300gsm card. 
Guest Art Prints
'Blue' by Viviane Doan (12" x 12"), and 'Into The Deep' by Vicious Mongrel (210mm x 297mm). Both of these pieces are printed onto Hahnemühle German Etching paper; a natural white, uncoated paper with a delicate, tactile texture. 
Vicious Mongrel: Artist. Doom and gloom connoisseur. Twitter | Portfolio
Viviane Doan: Character design & visual development. Twitter | Portfolio
Call Me Under Comic
This beautiful 10-page greyscale comic serves as a prelude to the night that our story begins and throws you directly into the world of Styx. Illustrated by Sam C. and written by Son M. who together make up SCSM comics;  a duo who has worked together since 2016. Their original titles include A Vampire In Paris & ANIMALHEADS. 
Son M. | Sam C.
Mini Story: Shadowless Night by Emmett Nahil
A short story with illustrations detailing the fateful night that Simon Kastor left his life behind. Printed as a saddle-stitched zine (A5/210mm X 148mm) on uncoated paper. Emmett Nahil is a queer novelist, editor, narrative designer, game dev, and literary jack of all trades. He’s interested in intersectional analysis, diverse representation for other Middle Easterners, and bringing more nuanced work to Horror and SF/F.  Twitter | Website
Light + Shadow Enamel Pins
'In Light' is silver-plated and 'In Shadow' is gold plated. Both pins will have a foiled backing card, rubber clutches, come in a keepsake pouch, and will be 50mm. 
Fallen Angel T-Shirt
Screen-printed onto a unisex premium cotton t-shirt with super soft waterbased inks. Design by Nadine Lawton. For sizing information please click here. This will be available in sizes small to 2XL. 
Secrets of Styx: Compendium 
Our compendium will be the definitive guide to the creation of Call Me Under. This full-color tome will include artwork from concept to finished pieces, character profiles, exclusive stories, lore, and much more. The book will case-bound and in a hardback format (A5/210mm X 148mm) with 200gsm uncoated interior pages. 
Add-on item available when you pledge.
Lunaris Games is a small indie development studio with a passion for creating immersive, narrative-driven stories filled with diverse characters. We’re based in the UK but our team of diverse developers is spread across Europe and America. We believe that representation matters, whether it be solving supernatural murders, saving a kingdom, or taking a deep dive into an eldritch-horror-infested world. We're a worker-owned studio that self-publishes all of our titles.
Producer, Narrative Designer & Lead Writer: Kris Wise
Writer: Khanh Nguyen
Art Direction, Sprites & Key Art: Anna Tsagada
Additional Art: Nadine Lawton
Editor & Diversity Consult: Toiya Kristen Finley
Background Art: Bailey Cooper
Voice Direction & Casting: Souha Al-Samkari (Truant Pixel)
Music: Dorrell Ettienne
Programming: Jude White & Kris Wise
UI/UX: Edd Coates
With Special Thanks to Marina & Lennox 
Please check out our other titles if you have the time!
- When The Night Comes, a supernatural murder mystery currently rated#3 on itch.io's top-rated games and coming to Nintendo Switch and Steam in 2021. (With voice acting, new art, and UI improvements!)
- Errant Kingdom, a high-fantasy drama that updates episodically. We plan to release the final chapter for this in early 2021, but you can play the Prologue-Chapter Four right now on both itch.io and Steam. We successfully surpassed our funding goal for this title on Kickstarter in September 2019 after showing our demo at PAX West.
campaign.risks:
Risks and challenges
Lunaris Games are a solid team who have worked together over the last two years since our founding. We've successfully released two episodic visual novels with fewer resources than we have now, and we have no doubt that we will be able to deliver this title, especially where we are now switching to a full-release format instead of episodic. Our team leader is also highly experienced in merchandise procurement and fulfillment, so we're confident that with all of our rewards already created, we will be able to order and deliver the goods in a timely manner when we are ready to release. We also run a webshop for our merchandise throughout the year.
Learn about accountability on Kickstarter
campaign.env:
Environmental commitments
Visit our Environmental Resources Center to learn how Kickstarter encourages sustainable practices.
Reusability and recyclability
The grass paper packaging we use for shipping our packages is 100% compostable, recyclable, biodegradable, and plastic-free. We also refrain from using any plastic wallets/bags e.g for enamel pins and instead opt to use organza keepsake pouches that can be reused.
Sustainable materials
We use a local independent screen-printer for our t-shirts who use water-based & discharge inks that are Soil Association Approved (organic).
Sustainable Distribution
We have designated recycling in place at our HQ and take great care to ensure that any waste we cannot reuse or recycle is disposed of responsibly. Any leftover packaging or merch items will be utilized for our online store.
